snippet: The utility is focusing on essential operations as about 5,000 managers replace the approximately 8,000 union workers whose contract expired at 12:01 a.m. Sunday.
abstract: More than 8,000 Consolidated Edison Company workers in New York City are locked out after their contract expires, leaving about 5,000 managers to step in and do their jobs; union leaders warn that the managers may not have the numbers or training required to deal with a potential power outage caused by hot weather and increased demand.
lead_paragraph: The utility is focusing on essential operations as about 5,000 managers replace the approximately 8,000 union workers whose contract expired at 12:01 a.m. Sunday.

headline.seo: Con Ed Locks Out Workers After Talks With Union Break Down
headline.main: Con Ed Curtails Services After Talks Break Down
headline.print_headline: Labor Lockout At Con Edison After Collapse Of Union Talks
